clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Follow up of the DVR-A Locking Plate
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Follow Up Study Into The Use Of The DVR-A Locking Plate In The Treatment Of Distal Radial Fractures

lead_sponsor.agency: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

clinical_study.source: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock:
The surgical treatment of wrist fractures (distal radius bone) has been changed by the introduction of a new plate design, the locking plate. This results in improved fixation and stabilisation of the fracture fragments allowing early movement.
This type of plate has been increasingly used throughout the world but questions have been raised regarding the potential complications of the surgery, particularly nerve and tendon injury. The Norfolk and Norwich Hospital has treated over 250 distal radial fractures with this type of plate. The investigators plan to recall these patients to asses their long term function, general satisfaction and radiological results.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
primary_outcome.description: Disability of arm shoulder and hand score. This is a patient administered validated score

primary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
primary_outcome.description: A patient administered visual analogue scale numbered 1-10. A mark can be placed anywhere along the line with a score of 0 indicating no pain and 10 the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Examination and questioning by a hand therapist to pick up complications. Prompting for tendon irritation or rupture, neurovascular injury, plate or screw failure, hardware removal and infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Review of xrays to measure radial inclination, volar tilt,, shortening, articular stepoff and degenerative change

secondary_outcome.time_frame: More than one year post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Euroqual 5D is a patient administered general health questionaire that is validated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a dynomometer and referenced to the non operated side

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a goniometer. Measurements taken of movements in the axial,coronal and sagital planes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year or more post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A patient administered visual analogue scale numbered 1-10. A mark can be placed anywhere along the line with a score of 0 indicating no pain and 10 the worst pain imaginable

clinical_study.condition: Distal Radial Fractures Treated With a DVR-A Locking Plate

arm_group.description: Patients with a distal radial fracture treated with a DVR-A locking plate

intervention.description: Size, length of plate and number os screws decided by operating surgeon

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be taken from a population consisting of all patients who have undergone distal radial fracture treatement with a DVR-A locking plate at the norfolk and Norwich University hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment between Jan 2005 and March 2009
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 16
- Unable to consent
- Pregnant
